solution_line_template: The used car lot has {total_vehicles} / {motorcycle_fraction_denominator} = <<{total_vehicles}/{motorcycle_fraction_denominator}={motorcycles}>>{motorcycles} motorcycles with {tires_per_motorcycle} tires each.
The lot has {total_vehicles} - {motorcycles} = <<{total_vehicles}-{motorcycles}={cars}>>{cars} cars for sale
There are {cars} / {spare_tire_fraction_denominator} = {cars_with_spare_tire} cars with a spare tire with {tires_per_car_with_spare} tires each.
The lot has {cars} - {cars_with_spare_tire} = <<{cars}-{cars_with_spare_tire}={cars_without_spare_tire}>>{cars_without_spare_tire} cars with {tires_per_car_without_spare} tires each.

Thus, the used car lot's vehicles have {motorcycles} * {tires_per_motorcycle} + {cars_with_spare_tire} * {tires_per_car_with_spare} + {cars_without_spare_tire} * {tires_per_car_without_spare} = {motorcycles_tires_subtotal} + {cars_with_spare_tires_subtotal} + {cars_without_spare_tires_subtotal} = <<{motorcycles}*{tires_per_motorcycle}+{cars_with_spare_tire}*{tires_per_car_with_spare}+{cars_without_spare_tire}*{tires_per_car_without_spare}={total_tires}>>{total_tires} tires in all.
